item.title: Low power software architecture
item.description: Many devices these days are battery powered. Being battery powered requires that we create software to make the most possible use of the battery. Software for low-power devices behaves very differently to normal software in a few regards: Spend most most of its time in low-power-mode (or even off). Startup very quickly. Shutdown very quickly. Devices must be off by default and only turned on while used. Power rails for devices must be under the control of the software.
